creator: priscilla@walmsley.com
text:
I am getting a stack overflow error when maxOccurs is more than 22000 or so on 
an element (within a sequence group in a complex type).  It seems like it's OK 
to have a limit on what is supported by Xerces, but it should at least be 
documented.

  <xsd:complexType name="test">
    <xsd:sequence>
        <xsd:element name="x" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="22000"/>
    </xsd:sequence>
  </xsd:complexType>

creator: zongaro@ca.ibm.com
text:
This problem was previously reported as bug 3277.

The problem with documenting the limit is that there is no specific limit.  It
really depends on the memory available and the complexity of the content of the
particle for which the maxOccurs attribute as specified.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 3277 ***
